properties.name: grid-template-columns
properties.percentages: refer to corresponding dimension of the content area
properties.computedValue: the keyword none or the keyword masonry or a [[computed track list]]

properties.name: grid-template-rows
properties.percentages: refer to corresponding dimension of the content area
properties.computedValue: the keyword none or the keyword masonry or a [[computed track list]]

properties.name: grid-auto-flow
properties.value: [ row | column | row-reverse | column-reverse ] || dense || wrap-reverse

values.name: row-reverse
values.prose: This specification extends the grid-auto-flow property to add row-reverse, column-reverse, and wrap-reverse, which reverse the directions of the grid item placement algorithm.

values.name: column-reverse
values.prose: This specification extends the grid-auto-flow property to add row-reverse, column-reverse, and wrap-reverse, which reverse the directions of the grid item placement algorithm.

values.name: wrap-reverse
values.prose: This specification extends the grid-auto-flow property to add row-reverse, column-reverse, and wrap-reverse, which reverse the directions of the grid item placement algorithm.

values.name: masonry
values.prose: This value causes an element to generate a masonry container box that is block-level when placed in flow layout.

values.name: inline-masonry
values.prose: This value causes an element to generate a masonry container box that is inline-level when placed in flow layout.

values.name: column
values.prose: The masonry container’s stacking axis is its block axis, and masonry layout starts from its block-start edge.

values.name: column-reverse
values.prose: The masonry container’s stacking axis is its block axis, and masonry layout starts from its block-end edge.

values.name: row
values.prose: The masonry container’s stacking axis is its inline axis, and masonry layout starts from its inline-start edge.

values.name: row-reverse
values.prose: The masonry container’s stacking axis is its inline axis, and masonry layout starts from its inline-end edge.

values.name: tie-start
values.prose: Ties are broken by putting the item in the start-most tied position.

values.name: tie-end
values.prose: Ties are broken by putting the item in the end-most tied position.

properties.name: masonry-template-tracks
properties.percentages: refer to corresponding dimension of the content area
properties.computedValue: by computed value type per item in the computed track list
properties.animationType: if list lengths match, by computed value type; otherwise, discrete

properties.name: masonry-template-areas
properties.computedValue: the keyword none or a string

properties.name: masonry-auto-tracks
properties.percentages: refer to corresponding dimension of the content area
properties.animationType: if the list lengths match, by computed value type per item; discrete otherwise

properties.name: masonry-slack
properties.percentages: relative to the grid-axis content box size of the masonry container

values.name: <length-percentage>
values.prose: Specifies the tie threshold for the masonry container. Placement positions are considered to be equally good (“tied”) if they are within the specified distance from the shortest position.

values.name: infinite
values.prose: Specifies an infinite tie threshold. This makes items distribute themselves strictly in order, without considering the length of the tracks at all.

warnings.name: auto-areas
warnings.prose: The new auto-areas value for the repeat() notation represents the number of repetitions necessary for the total number of explicit tracks to match the grid-template-areas / masonry-template-areas value in effect in the corresponding axis. If multiple tracks are listed for the repetition, the final repetition is truncated as necessary to produce the correct number of tracks.
